author: Brodigan
description: Steven Crowder is at it again, taking it to the streets. Today, we find some people who look like they could be immigrants to comment on President Donald Trump’s immigration policy. In this episode, we see the good (from Cuba), the bad (from Mexico) and somewhere in the middle (China).
title: 🔴 Watch! I Want You to Leave My Country | Talking With People Immigration Edition

author: Danielle Berjikian
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

It’s clear by now that the effects of Biden’s open border policies will affect America for years to come.

The left believes deporting 3,000 illegals a day is cruel and far too much. However, according to Homan, we need to more than double this if we wish to even put a dent in the damage the Biden Administration ca
title: Tom Homan declares deporting 3000 illegals a day not enough, needs to bump those numbers up to 7000

author: Danielle Berjikian
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

While Americans and foreign nationals continue to protest and riot in the United States under the slogan "no human is illegal," a very different sentiment is emerging at our southern border.

It turns out that open-border policies are largely a phenomenon of the Western world, while most other countries show little interest in taking on the world’s challenges. Who would’ve thought?

Rioters in Mexico City are demanding that Americans stop moving to the United States, as they claim gentrification is affecting that area and making housing unaffordable for everyone else.

NEW: Rioters in Mexico
title: Mexico City Rioters demand Americans stop immigrating to THEIR country and stealing THEIR homes (and DHS got jokes)

author: Danielle Berjikian
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

It would be one thing if radical vegan activists were just advocating for better conditions on factory farms, but that’s not really what we tend to see. What makes animal rights activists so insufferable is that their demands almost always involve using “shock tactics” to grab attention. This can range from interrupting restaurants or grocery stores to confront customers, to, in this case, gluing themselves to a Trader Joe’s fridge and disrupting innocent people just trying to run errands — people who have nothing to do with what they’re supposedly fighting against.

An animal rights activist is facing charges after gluing himself to the chicken section at a Trader J
title: Animal rights activist glues hand to Trader Joe's fridge, discovers what the word "felony" means

author: Brodigan
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

You may have heard that Donald Trump and Republicans slashed Medicaid and are going to go extinct in 2026 as a result. If YOU heard that, you know it's bullplop because Medicaid wasn't slashed. Able-bodied adults with no kids will now have to work a total of 20 hours a week and fill out a form twice a year to stay on it. But Democrats don't want you to know that and will lie, knowing they can count on CNN to swear by it.

That is something CNN's Dana Bash attempted to do this weekend to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Bessent noticed the real problem is a pattern with Democrats. Much like when it comes to getting an ID in order to vote, Democrats and the media (bu
title: Trump Treasury Secretary cuts through CNN's BS about Medicaid cuts: "Democrats think poor people are stupid" [WATCH]

author: Brodigan
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

The new "Superman" movie is set to hit theaters this weekend, and for a while, it seemed like we were going to get a comic movie without any of the filmmakers ruining it with ill-advised political comments. So, of course, the weekend before the release date, here comes James Gunn trying to make the movie into an analogy on immigration in America. Worst of all, he does this to a British press outlet.

Or, he at least sort of does it. His comments are being blown out of proportion somewhat, but people are talking about so let's do that. I'm mostly disappointed because the last time reporters tried to bait Gunn,
title: "Superman" director makes obnoxious comments about politics and immigration because Heaven forbid we get a comic movie without it
